info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:30PM EDT until June 22 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL GREENSVILLE...WEST CENTRAL ISLE OF WIGHT...SOUTHAMPTON... SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...SUSSEX...SOUTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FRANKLIN... At 430 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dendron to near Homeville to near Sussex to 7 miles north of Purdy to near Dinwiddie, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Jarratt around 440 PM EDT. Ivor and Sedley around 445 PM EDT. Emporia, Courtland and Zuni around 450 PM EDT. Franklin, Green Plain and Hunterdale around 455 PM EDT. Boykins, Newsoms and Claresville around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Vicksville, Booth Fork, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Booker, Yale, Lumberton, Ellis Fork, Wharfs Store and Worrell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
